bibl.title: Military Orders from Walter Wyman to Henry Rose Carter, June 22, 1899

div1.p: Wyman issues new orders to Carter, making him the quarantine officer at the port of Havana.

div1.head: Military Orders from Walter Wyman to Henry Rose Carter, June 22, 1899
div1.opener:
In answering this Letter, please refer to the initials in upper left-hand corner.
JWB Treasury Department,
Office of the Supervising Surgeon-General
Marine-Hospital Service,
J.W.B.
L.
Washington, D.C., June 22, 1899
Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Marine Hospital Service,
Habana, Cuba.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have to inclose herewith a copy of General Orders No.
15, issued by the War Department, Headquarters of the Army,
Adjutant General's Office, January 20, 1899, which embraces
an order signed by the President relating to quarantine in
Cuba and Porto Rico, dated January 17, 1899. In accordance
with this Executive order, by direction of the Secretary of
the Treasury, you are hereby detailed as quarantine officer
at the port of Habana, to take effect July 1st, x vice Sanitary
Inspector W. F. Brunner, who has tendered his resignation to
take effect June 30, 1899. You are directed to confer with the
Military Governor of the Island, General John R. Brooke, and
also with the Military Governor of Habana, General William
Ludlow, with a view to securing their cooperation in the per-
formance of your quarantine duties.
div1.closer:
Respectfully yours, Walter Wyman Surgeon-General, M. H. S.
[unclear]
APPROVED:
